** Fantastic pool, hot tub, Close to restaurants, coffee shops, stores, etc, Items for guests to use at the beach, pool, tennis, snorkeling.
** Aug 15-19, 2022 Pool and hot tub closed for maintenance. Rental rates reflect this for those dates.
** Pickleball & Tennis courts

The space
Fourth floor unit captures the tradewinds and views. The lawn at the Maui Sunset is like a putting green (heaven for bare feet). And yes there is a putting green too. The beach is right out in front of the unit, a short walk across the lawn area.

Other things to note
Washer and Dryer in unit. Full sized units - not the common small stackable W/D common in condos. Fully stocked with towels, kitchen
neighborhood_overview: The city of Kihei has it all.  Great restaurants, different beaches to explore, restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, flea markets, post office and more.
host_about:
Paul and Joan currently reside in Spring Branch, Texas and summer in Minnesota.  Prior to that they have lived in San Diego, the Philippines, Maryland, Virginia,  Albuquerque, New Mexico, Corpus Christi Texas and West Virginia.   Paul was lucky to have spent two years on Oahu as a child. A medical meeting on Maui rekindled the passion for Hawaii. They love to visit the different beaches, snorkeling, kitesurfing (Paul), and relaxing on the lanai - especially the mornings and sunsets.
    After exploring all the condos in Kihei we chose the Maui Sunset for it's ambiance, impeccable grounds and pool. Everyone was so friendly. When we first walked into the condo we ultimately purchased we were left breathless by the view, and knew it was the right one. Our beach is never crowded and perfect for daily walks and paddle boarding.  The central location of our condo makes it easy for us to explore the rest of Maui.
      We keep our condo equipped the way we like to enjoy it. We've taken care in updating our condo with modern features. Our guests appreciate these touches and all the amenities we leave for them to enjoy. Joan loves to cook, and we always have dinner parties with friends when we visit. Most days we take small half-day trips to enjoy all that Maui has to offer. By late afternoon we love to soak in the pool and hot tub, read, and talk with our friends (old and new). We cook most of our meals in the condo or outside on the BBQs.  We can share our favorite restaurant choices with you.  Our sunsets from the lanai are awesome.   Morning coffee and tea out on the lanai and watching the West Maui mountains illuminate with the rising sun never gets old with us.

The space
It's prime location offers convenient access to other areas of Maui, such as the airport in Kahului, the charming town of Kihei, beautiful Wailea, historical Lahaina and Ma'alaea Bay, famous for whale watching, turtle sightings and The Maui Ocean Center.

Adjacent to the resort is the Hawaiian Islands Humpback Whale National Marine Sanctuary, along with the historical 16th Century Alii (Royal) Fish Pond of Kalepolepo. Protected by offshore reefs, the pond provides a safe swimming area for children and those who prefer a gentle surf.

description:
We have newly installed air conditioning for your comfort! Hale "Hā Hā" is located 3 blocks from the ocean, and a short drive to Pahoa town for stores, services and nightlife. Experience the Big Island the way that the locals do. Explore the Hamakua Coast. Visit green and black sand beaches and the world's largest active volcano, Mauna Loa. Visit Volcano National Park. Currently Kilauea is not active, but one never knows when it will erupt!

The space
Hale "Hā Hā" is a newly renovated one-bedroom, one-bath apartment that has separate living quarters with a private entrance and a relaxing lanai. We provide some local Hawaiian products, along with coffee and tea. The kitchenette is fully stocked with an induction burner, microwave oven, refrigerator, plates, silverware, blender, toaster and pots and pans. The lanai also has a Kamado charcoal barbecue for our guests to use. We are a short walk to Kahakai Park, our neighborhood ocean-front park. Our property is surr
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is located within the Hawaiian Parks/Beaches neighborhood. We are 3 blocks from Kahakai Park, our neighborhood ocean-front park. Many birds inhabit the surrounding jungle areas and you are close enough to hear and sometimes feel the ocean waves breaking on the shoreline.
host_about: Allen and his wife have  moved from the Central Coast, California a couple of years ago to the Pahoa area on the Big Island. After visiting the Big Island for over a decade, they are now living the Hawaiian dream. They enjoy every aspect of living the coastal life - from swimming to enjoying local foods and activities! Allen will be happy to share information about the local scene.

description:
Quietly nestled in the heart of Ma’alaea, ocean front Ma’alaea Kai # 214 tempts you to relax and hang out at the resort, while its central location and proximity to main roads invite you to venture forth to all points Maui! Spacious for 4 guests!

Quietly nestled in the heart of Ma’alaea, ocean front Ma’alaea Kai # 214 tempts you to relax and hang out at the resort, while its central location and proximity to main roads invite you to venture forth to all points Maui! The unit has a queen bed, sofa sleeper, full bathroom, and kitchen making it comfortable for four guests. The upscale remodeled kitchen is fully equipped, you should try your hand at pupu prep (appetizers) and island style cooking. If you prefer grilling, head out to the BBQ areas, where it’s a real treat to meet and “talk story” with fellow guests, before heading back to dine on your lanai. description:
The space
Maui Kamaole K110

Luxury and privacy meet at this Kihei Condo, located in the condo resort known as Maui Kamaole®, and just minutes away from the three sunny Kamaole beaches. Kamaole Beach Park III, located just across South Kihei Road, is one of South Maui’s best swimming, snorkeling, and sunning beaches. This luxurious and extra-spacious condo showcases a lovely view. Strolling the grounds of this low-rise property, you'll discover tropical gardens, two pools (the lower pool is heated), a pool spa, tennis courts, and barbecue areas. Comfortably and elegantly furnished, this home provides many perks that include free high-speed WiFi, free cable TV, a DVD player, a washer/dryer, and a well-equipped kitchen. In-room safes are available. The spacious lanai offers spectacular views and a true taste of Hawaiian living.

THINGS TO KNOW
This property does not include elevators.
MAUI KAMAOLE® is a federally registered trademark owne
host_about:
Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remains true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

description:
Aloha! This charming, cottage-style condo is located at the 35-acre Kiahuna Plantation Resort next to Poipu Beach, Kauai's beautiful South Shore. The Resort is beautifully landscaped with rolling lawns, Koi ponds, the famous Moir Gardens, and has its very own world class sandy beach. We are a short walk from the beach, Poipu Beach Athletic Club (access included) and Poipu Shopping Village for various activities and supplies.

Be sure to watch our Youtube video.

HVAC & Washer/Dryer in unit.

The space
Our 1-bedroom(king), 1-bathroom condo with a queen sofa bed is located on the first floor (no stairs) and has a private lanai surrounded by Kaua’i native tropical vegetation. Full kitchen and nearby outdoor BBQ are available for cooking meals. Not that you will spend much time inside watching TV but we have a brand new 65" HD TV in the living room and another TV in the bedroom. Our condo has Spectrum Cable TV and High Speed Wifi. In the living roo
neighborhood_overview: The Poipu Shopping Village is a short walk across Poipu Road. It features several restaurants, grocery store, Starbucks, and many shops for gifts, art, activities, and clothing. Kiahuna Golf Club and Poipu Bay Golf Club are both minutes away. Additional activities are also available. Just check with the friendly folks at the on-site Activities desk.
host_about: We fell in love with Hawai'i on our trip there in March of 2019 and are excited to share our beautiful condo with you.  We are committed to serving our guests at the highest level so that you can have a wonderful stay in paradise. We look forward to you booking your next adventure with us. Mahalo!

description:
***AUGUST SUMMER SPECIALS! ***

Your new Kauai Beach Villas' spot is a cozy resort that is right on the sand immediately north of one of the best beaches on the island and only one hour from the island’s North and South Shores. Take a few steps from the resort and you will find yourself on the soft sand beach with views of the rolling turquoise waves.

The space
Lydgate State Park is one of the best beaches for snorkeling and swimming in the clear-blue waters of two protected lagoons. Spouting Horn Park is one of the most photographed spots on Kauai where you will be met with fascinating rock formations that shoot out water every time the waves roll in. Golfers will enjoy a day at Wailua Golf Course where you can tee off on the rolling greens in the refreshing breeze with views of the ocean. Or, experience Hawaii’s traditional luau with fire dancing and a delicious Hawaiian dinner. Get an in-depth taste of Kauai on a four-hour sensory tour with tastings

IMPORTANT: The state of Hawai’i is currently undergoing many road repair(s) and other CONSTRUCTION. Please note that there may be Condo’s at Hilo Terrace effected from this (ex: water turning off for a few hours).

This is a condo complex near schools and other houses. There are many families & locals who also live on the premises. At night you may hear some coqui frogs that make unique sounds. There is a security guard to insure safety on site.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood has rural character with properties of 2 acres or larger. Most lots have one or two homes and some are still undeveloped. Most homes are occupied by residents. Nights are quiet and peaceful, no street lights, only stars and the moon.
host_about:
Born and raised in Germany, moved to Maui in 1990. Established my vacation rental business in 1991. I love to be a host and accommodate guests from all over the world. We moved recently our office from Paia town to  Haiku and are available by appointment Monday to Friday 9am - 4pm. We have a wonderful team working together for a long time.  AJ is our reservation manager, Terry manages the properties and you will find Margit mostly in the office.
My special interest is my family and pets,  Hawaiian Culture,  Hula, History, Music and Language, hiking, birds and plants of our islands.

host_about: After years of traveling to Kauai for vacation, we decided it is time to become more committed to the ocean lifestyle my wife and I both love. With a mother born and raised on the island of Bermuda, my love for island life started early. And my wife, a 'left-coaster', spent her youth daytripping to Oregon's beautiful Pacific Coast. Kauai is now our home and we couldn't be happier with all that Kauai has to offer and explore.

neighborhood_overview:
Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki briming with island personality offers a range of accommodations that are perfect for couples and solo travelers. On-site amenities include an open-air lobby, pool deck, Wi-Fi, and barbeque grills are included in all stays.

The Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki is located just a block from the International Marketplace and two blocks to the beachfront of Waikiki. Short driving distance will take you to Downtown Honolulu, the University of Hawaii, and historic experiences like Pearl Harbor and Iolani Palace.

Enjoy world-class shopping, dining, and nightlife at the International Marketplace, stroll the beachfront of Waikiki for surf lessons and sunset watching, or take in a hike at the nearby Diamond Head for an overview of Honolulu’s magnificent coastline. Whatever adventure abound, the location and the value at Aqua Aloha Surf Waikiki are unmatched.

description:

The space

Well maintained high floor unit with great mountain views of Manoa Valley and Tantalus. Suburb ocean view from the lanai. Sit out on the lanai with your breakfast and coffee and feel the sweet morning breezes.

host_about:
My name is Tiare Dutcher (RB-22030).  My main profile picture shows the Tiare Tahiti, a flower also called the Tahitian Gardenia.  It smells great...   One of my favorite flowers

I'm an artist with an MFA from the University of Hawai`i, but I became a real estate broker in order to support my disabled husband of 60 years, who passed away in July 2022.

I manage thirteen one bedroom condos in the Waikiki Skytower (three short blocks from the beach), one two bedroom, two bath condo in the Fairway Villa,just three blocks from Waikiki beach and one block to the International Marketplace, and one legal vacation rental studio at the Waikiki Grand Hotel, just a half block from the beach. I own a small real estate company, DW Realty LLC (RB-22573), located at 1123 11th Avenue #403, Honolulu, HI 96816, so if you want to buy something here on Oahu, I can help with that too.  My son is also a real estate broker and property manager, and we have helped a lot of people find their special place.  

My son and I both love helping people find a great place to stay on their vacation.

I love living in Hawai`i, and I live in Waikiki, so I'm close to the rentals I manage.  I'm almost always  available...

For three years, in the 1960s, before GPS, my husband and I sailed around the South Pacific on our 38' sailboat--no kids then, just our cat.  Finally, we came to Hawai`i, and we have pretty much been here ever since.  Both our kids were born here.  All of us are Hawaiians at heart.

description:

The condo offers many kid friendly amenities, making it the perfect choice for a family. The spacious and modern interior design makes any overpriced hotel room pale in comparison.

The space

Enjoy unobstructed views of the Waikiki marina, the beach and of course the famous Friday night fireworks right from the comfort of your quaint balcony. The condo is located just a stone's throw from the beach, countless high end restaurants and small mom and pops local eateries, ice cream parlors, bars and the best shopping in the world. The famous Hilton Hawaiian village and the beach where Ha
neighborhood_overview: In addition to the beautiful beach nearby, a selection of Honolulu’s finest restaurants and attractions are located just a short walk from the condo. Iron Chef Morimoto’s restaurant, Sorento’s Italian eatery, Harbour Pizza, and Chart House Seafood+Beef are all located nearby. East of Ilikai Marina, you’ll find Hilton Hawaiian Village and Wakiki Strip for more shopping and dining. Just a ten minute walk to the west of the building lies Ala Moana Mall, which offers an amazing shopping experience with over 200 stores. For nightlife, check out Addiction Nightclub and any one of the location’s assortment of bars.

Magic island just minutes away in the opposite direction. Groceries, ABC stores and all the great restaurants, shops and entertainment that Waikiki offers are all in walking distance from the condo. The building is close to everything you need yet, far enough away from the noice that comes along with all the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.

Enjoy comedy night at Blue Note, a beer at Maui brewing or Yard House or a Sunset Dinner at Dukes. All just an eye-catching tropical walk from the condo building.

I enjoy interior design (as you'll see if staying at my house), gardening, SUP and exploring the islands. If you need recommendations on how to make your trip to Oahu the best, I am happy to help!

neighborhood_overview:
NEIGHBORHOOD
Kahana offers a taste of THE REAL MAUI away from the bustle of the big resorts. You'll find a mixture of locals, surfers and visitors enjoying the white sand beaches, killer sunsets and local eateries. On the ground floor of our building is the famous Miso Phat Sushi, voted best sushi on the island! There is also a grocery/liquor store, Bar and Grill, water sports rental store, and a day spa. There are more restaurants, banks, Maui Brewing Company and a coffee shop across the street. We are also a short way to the neighboring town of Honokowai which offers a farmers market, coffee shop, restaurants and cute shopping spots. Drive 10-15 mins north and you'll enter lush Napili and the ultra lux resort and golf community of Kapalua.

BEACHES
We are right across the street from Kahana Beach and Pohaku Beach Park! Kahana Beach offers white sand, turquoise waters and killer SNORKELING conditions most of the year. The nearshore ocean bottom is shallow with a m
host_about: We are a local husband and wife team who manage our own properties. We are very hands on and highly responsive to our guests’ needs. We love the islands and we hope you will too! By booking with us, you are contributing to our baby’s college fund. Thank you!

description:
Beach front condo at Kahalu'u Beach (Turtle Beach) with incredible Ocean and Sunset views. Swimming, snorkeling, surfing, & tide pool directly across street. Off street parking, infinity pool, lava rock spa & barbecue area with tables, chairs, umbrellas and lounge chairs in condo complex.

Shopping and restaurants (including famous Sam Choy's Kai Lanai) are all within a short distance, making our condo a comfortable home away from home.

Central Air optional at $15 extra per night plus tax.

The space
This lovely, spacious condo at Kahalu'u Beach (Turtle Beach) has incredible Ocean and Sunset views, and is the perfect escape for guests wanting easy access to swimming, snorkeling, surfing and golfing. Ours is an unit on the ground floor in the back with unobstructed views of the ocean and coastline (no stairs and away from street noise).

Our complex, the Beach Villa, is the newest development in Kailua-Kona and offers off-street p
neighborhood_overview:
Across street from the condo is the stop for the open air trolley running every hour to the pier and into town where a variety of stores, restaurants and bars are located. Along the way are beaches and fantastic vistas. The Sheraton hosts the Giant Manta Rays show every night. After dinner and the show, guests may catch the convenient trolley back to the condo.

Kayaks can be rented at $40 per day at Keauheous Bay which is within walking distance from the condo. Boats trips to nearby famous snorkeling/diving spots like Captain Cook and City of Refuge are offered at docks within 1/2 mile of the condo .

Guests will love the morning or evening strolls along beautiful Alii Drive. There are so many little coves and areas where one can just walk out on smooth lava rocks in between homes and take in the gorgeous views.
host_about:
My family lives in Laguna Beach, Southern California.   My wife and I enjoy strolling along the beach taking in the fresh air and watching the beautiful seascape.  My three sons are avid surfers and bogey boarders.  They are out there catching the waves whenever they have a free moment.

Despite the surf and sand in California, we vacation in the Big Island of Hawaii frequently because of the bluer and warmer water, the greener and lusher vegetation, the colorful tropical fish and the longer riding waves.  Besides, we have many cousins throughout the Hawaii Island.  

My son jumped at the opportunity of buying this unit together with a friend when it became available in early 2014.  We enjoy the snorkeling and the surfing across street from the condo so much that we just bought another unit in this small beach front complex when it became available.  We now have two adjacent units at this favorite spot of ours in Hawaii to which the entire family can return together every year --- we never get tired of it.

host_about:
Kona Coast Vacations hosts over 5,400 reservations a year with the help of knowledgeable management, proficient team members and trusted home owners. Open 7 days a week, we strive to help with each visitors’ every need. Sharing Aloha from the first contact whether it is phone or email, we are here to assist by making the booking process as seamless as can be. We pride ourselves on providing hands on assistance whenever it is needed, whether it is reservation details, maintenance issues, or even booking activities! 

Kona Coast Vacations is fortunate to team up with great property owners which is instrumental in providing exceptional homes for our new and returning guests. With over 240 vacation rentals from oceanfront homes, ocean view condos and private estates, we are here for your every need, open seven days a week to take care of our guests and owners. With two locations in Kailua Kona and Mauna Lani we have dedicated specialists in guest services managing reservations, maintenance, and property checks alongside our accounting, support and marketing specialists. We are proud to be Airbnb members since 2001 and now are Superhosts with over 1070 reviews.
We hope to host you Hawaii and help create a memory to last you a lifetime. We are your “’Ohana” (family) on the Big Island of Hawaii, please do not hesitate to utilize our listed resources and book activities thru Kona Concierge.

neighborhood_overview: Return home from a day at the best beaches in the world, and enjoy a tropical cocktail or glass of wine while walking to the Hanalei Bay sunset overlook, facing Makana ('The Gift') mountain. The Princeville Resort is just a stunning one-mile walk or drive away. They have a comfortable bar and outdoor lanai to take in the epic backdrop of iconic Hanalei Bay and the surrounding North Shore mountains. They offer a daily champagne toast at sunset, cocktails and have a fabulous brunch at Makana Terrace restaurant or the famous Jean-George Vongerichten 'Kauai Grill' featuring the areas' best of the best local ingredients. Pu'u Po'a beach right in front of the Princeville Resort, a short walk either down the side of the hotel or through it, is open to the public as are all beaches on Kaua'i. There are also a couple of more secluded pristine beaches that are only walkable (Hideaways and Pali Ke Kua). Lacking public parking, they are almost impossible for others to get to. host_about:
Vacationing in Maui doesn’t get better than Kamaole Sands, a condo resort built on 15 acres of gardens, waterfalls, and ponds. Live like you’ve always wanted to in an individually furnished condominium suite directly across from Kihei’s popular Kamaole Beach Park III. Defined by its laid-back vibe and tropical beauty, South Maui is a true Hawaiian paradise.

Our dreamy Kihei location near Wailea Resort and Makena Resort puts you in the midst of golf, spas and ocean recreation.

- Learn to surf at Kamaole Beach Park III
- Tee off at Maui Nui or Wailea golf clubs
- Stay on trend at The Shops at Wailea
- Snorkel amid the pristine waters of La Perouse Bay
- Indulge in spa treatments at Wailea Resort
- Sample craft brews at Maui Brewing Company

The best plan for your day is often no plan at all. Maybe you’ll start your morning with a swim in the Pacific or in our pool. You might mingle amid traveling kindred spirits at your resort’s Wednesday Mai Tai Party, and then grill a fresh catch with your new friends at the property’s public barbecue area. Or step out for a sunset dinner at one of Kihei’s fantastic cafes or bistros. Need to stay connected? We offer complimentary WiFi in the lobby, pool area, and all rooms.

Since 1993, Castle Resorts & Hotels has specialized in innovative hotel and resort management. We manage properties throughout the Hawaiian Islands, including Kauai, Oahu, Maui, Molokai, and Hawaii Island, as well as Auckland, New Zealand. Accommodations range from full-service hotels to resort condominiums and combines value, convenience, and authentic experiences.

host_about: Hello,   After seeing a lot of places around the world, I decided to split my time between  Kauai and Portugal.   Kauai  has everything that I love, beautiful beaches, great snorkeling, diving, incredible hikes, rivers, waterfalls, jungles, etc, etc.  I love to spend time in nature or traveling. Portugal is full of history, art and the gateway to Europe so it allows me to travel around a lot easier than when I am in Kauai.   As a host,  I hope to provide you with an excellent place to stay and all the information I have about this beautiful island, hope to see you soon.

description:
Entire downstairs of a two story custom built home. Fun, musical, artsy decor, including two bedrooms w/locks and comfortable living space with privacy to relax. Bathroom with shower and shared laundry . Outdoor kitchen with microwave, mini fridge, stove, and bbq. Outdoor dining area. This is a rural space with dogs, cats and chickens.
Hawaiian Paradise Park is centrally located, approx. 30-40 min. from Volcano National Park, Hilo town and nearby beaches.
2 bdrm rate at $119/night

The space
Hosted by musicians and artists who love color. Not a beige home. We are on Railroad Ave, our home next to a property that was 1 of original train stations. Legend is that people threw out their mango seeds, so this part of HPP is part Mango grove. It is a kipuka, meaning the last lava flow, went around this area, like an island, and therefore has more growth/dirt.

Guest access
Welcome to entire downstairs space, all outdoor spaces, tab
neighborhood_overview: Hawaiian Paradise Park is zoned as Ag land. We still have wild bamboo orchids that grow along the road.  We are the orchid isle!  Our road is not paved yet, though many in HPP are.   Each lot is an acre.  Residents might have livestock, exotic birds, there are palm orchards, and nurseries, etc.       The ocean is 20 blocks from us. We go there to walk, enjoy sunsets, full moons, exercise, watch for whales (winter) or fish off the cliffs.  NO sand beach, but beautiful. You could bike ride to cliffs from here, but walking would take a really long time.
host_about: Artists, pet lovers. chickens, cats and dogs.  Lonny was a professional musician in his youth and loves to build beautiful spaces, garden and entertain from home.  Previously hosted live musical events with multiple artists.  We're aiming towards self subsistence and currently grow some food, i.e pineapples, mangoes, papaya, bananas, avocado, fresh eggs.

neighborhood_overview:

• The Kapalua® Resort is the only low-density resort on Maui

Description:
The Ridge features two beautiful, heated swimming pools. Both pool areas feature gas grills, lounge chairs, a location for eating, with tables and chairs, a shower, a soda machine and restrooms. Pool “One” has an additional full kitchen and large covered gathering area, making this a
host_about:
Ridge Realty/Rentals LLC is the oldest, family owned real estate brokerage which specializes in properties at The Kapalua® Resort. For over thirty years we have maintained a solid track record, generating a customer loyalty that is second to none.  

When planning your next Maui dream vacation, do not make the mistake of staying in a hotel, most of which are small, overcrowded and overpriced. Start your vacation off right, and book your stay in one of our affordable spacious properties. All our properties come fully furnished and offer free high speed wireless internet, fully stocked kitchens, a starter supply of towels, soap/shampoo and laundry detergent, plus linens and all the other comforts of home.

Our clientele enjoy personal, around-the-clock service; staff are on-site, 24 hours a day.  Clients deserve the best and we deliver.  Allow our team to enhance your vacation with special touches; we will stock your pantry, arrange a limo service from the airport, or even create that perfect romantic atmosphere, just for your arrival – no matter the request, it is our pleasure the be there for you. We go the extra mile to ensure that your stay with Ridge Realty/Rentals is nothing short of extraordinary. Our number one priority is to accommodate you in creating a personalized, dream vacation that is as much stress free as it is memorable.

Kapalua® is fortunate to be able to claim three, world-class beaches. Kapalua Bay (rated the “number one beach in the world," by Conde Nast), Oneloa Bay and D.T. Fleming Beach are just a quick walk from all of our properties. Do not worry about parking or long drives; the best beaches in the world are just out your door!
All Kapalua® Resort activities and amenities are conveniently located within walking distance from all of our properties.  You do not feel like walking? No problem! The resort's complimentary shuttle will pick you up at your door, and then transport you to anywhere on the resort grounds.

At Ridge Realty/Rentals we feel fortunate to call Maui our home, and want nothing more than to share this beautiful paradise with you. With the warm sand between your toes, the sun upon your face and the soft trade winds at your back, you will discover an island way of living, offering the peaceful simplicity you have been searching for. We take pride in serving each and every one of our clients with the warmth of the Aloha Spirit.
 
Mahalo for your interest and we look forward to seeing you soon!

description:
Serene, remote, zen retreat in one of Hawaii's most scenic places: K’au region at Punalu'u Black Sand Beach. It’s a short 1/3 mile walk to the beach, crashing waves, palm trees & flowers, amazing mountain and ocean views, in the countryside of macademia nut & coffee farms. Incredible dark sky with countless stars. A gorgeous 30 minute drive to Volcanoes National Park. Far removed from the hustle of city life, welcome to the most remote inhabited place on the edge of the universe.

The space
8-11-23 Fortunately the wildfires had no damage to us on the Big Island, so everything is open as usual. The island of Maui was devastated, mostly in Lahaina, so please consider relief donations and no travel to Maui for now.

The gorgeous Punalu'u Black Sand beach and shoreline are a short walk or drive (1/3 mile). Please shop for groceries and drinks in Kailua Kona or Hilo before arriving, as there are few options in the immediate area. Once you arrive and rela
neighborhood_overview: The area is old unspoiled Hawaii.   We're between the towns of Naalehu (where you'll find the delicious famous Punalu’u Bakery, Kalae Coffee shop, 76 gas station with snacks, a small local grocery store called Will and Grace, Ace Hardware, Shaka Bar and Restaurant, Hana Hou restaurant) and Pahala (where you'll find Long's Drugstore, Bank of Hawaii, and a small grocery store called Mizuno Superette).  Nearby you can tour the Ka'u Coffee Mill to see and taste delicious local coffee (many say better than Kona coffee) and macademia nuts.  You'll definitely want space in your carry on to take some tasty treats home.

description:
The space
Located in South Kona, this Kona Paradise home is a wonderful place to come relax, cook a nice meal and watch the sunset on our enclosed covered lanai. Enjoy our very peaceful 2 bd/2ba home. Pebble Beach is just a short drive down the hill ( 4 mns. with steep but secured central Kaohe Rd.)where one can swim and snorkel as well as hike the King's Trail along the coast,South side of the beach. ( large parking at the End of Mapuna Rd- last one left side before the shore) . Another,HoOkena sand beach -friendly spot- at about 4 miles North on Hwy, is often the location where the dolphins come to play. Extra 5 miles North will take You to TWO STEPS,best for snorkeling. We are about at 20minutes drive through beautiful coffee farm lands,direction to the town of Kailua-Kona. In the direction of Volcanoes National Park, « Green Sand Beach » at South Point is about 40 minutes South
Private Bathroom and King size bed in Master bedroom with views of the ocean from
neighborhood_overview:
Kona Paradise is a very safe and clean neighborhood. Access to Pebbles Beach, at bottom of our Subdivision, is one of my favorite beaches. Parking : do take the last lateral Mapuna Rd.on your left. Sometimes ( only sometimes) it’s a bit rough ,mostly on Winter,and the current too strong to swim in , but one can always stay at the shore and let the waves roll you around on the pebbles. Very special and fun! Also some nice hiking along the coast line until a hill «  the cone « : 360° view, starting left side(South)of the beach .Could be attractive wild goats around,inoffensive wild pigs and their little ones,also some cute and funny small green geckos.Best Sunsets and ( or) Stars from the BEACH and the FRONT LANAI of the House.
Magic Time !
Kaohe rd.,the central rd. of Kona Paradise ,from Hwy. to the shore( Pebble Beach) is pretty steep ,but fully secured. To drive slowly..
host_about: I'm originally from Paris, France but grew up in Washington State where I learned to appreciate the beautiful outdoors. Now I live on the Big Island of Hawaii which is an amazing place to enjoy what nature has to offer. I love to hike, swim, cook, dance, yoga and just simply relax with a glass of rose wine in my hand and watch the sunsets!

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.

description:
Beautiful OCEAN VIEW & pool view from our 4th floor condo! Top floor, no overhead neighbors!

Enjoy the refreshing pool, surrounded by gorgeous landscaping…complete with a koi pond, BBQs & fire pit. You'll be right across from the ocean at one of the best surf spots in Hawaii--Lymans Surf Spot!

Elevator works as of Aug 10, 2023
You will need to ascend 4-5 stairs

Escape the hustle and bustle while relaxing at our quaint complex! With only 32 condos, our complex is peaceful & full of ALOHA!

The space
-Air-conditioned condo
-Ocean view from the lanai
-2.2 miles to down town Kona -- where there is plenty of shopping and restaurants!
-.8 mile to Magic Sands Beach (white sand beach)
-Walk to the Farmer's Market
-58" Roku Smart TV, with Direct TV in the living room
-Full sized washer and dryer
-California King Bed in primary bedroom, with ensuite and door to access the lanai with ocean view.
neighborhood_overview: We take great pride in providing our guests with a clean, comfortable, and welcoming space to call home during their Hawaiian vacation. Book now to experience the ultimate relaxation and rejuvenation in our 2BR/2BA condo in Kona, Hawaii!
host_about:
I love to explore new places and revisit favorites. I find that having a trip "on the books" keeps life exciting! If I'm not relaxing on a beach during a vacation, I'm out seeing the sites, appreciating the culture and of course, enjoying the food! I am a host of two cabins in South Lake Tahoe, a cabin in the Blue Ridge Mountains, and two condos in Hawai’i, so I can assure you I will be very respectful of your home and rules. 

I quickly learned that I absolutely love sharing our homes with fellow travelers, whether they’re coming for a local weekend getaway, or from across the world! I rarely get to meet our guests in person, but I truly want their experience at our place to be relaxing, memorable and seamless... and I’m just a message/text/phone call away if they need anything! I also love sharing some of our favorite activities, sites and restaurants in town.... so if a guest need some guidance, I’m happy to pass along our favorite experiences!

description:
The décor was designed to attract peace and harmony to your vacation. With hand painted art work throughout the house and peaceful touch of earthy colors décor. This vacation getaway welcomes happy and joyful company. You come as guest but leave as family.

The space
You can rent this entire gorgeous home with a cozy lanai in paradise surrounded by the beautiful natural Hawaiian scenery. It has one master bedroom with an adjoining bathroom plus two bedrooms with their own private bathroom.
It has a serene open floor plan; kitchen, living room, and dining room.
We invite you to come and create your own beautiful memories in our gorgeous home.
Enjoy a piece of our paradise!
host_about: We welcome you to the Big Island of Hawai'i to embrace the spirit of Aloha (Love) that extends beyond the island adventures into a beautiful and serene space where you can tap into yoga, music and other explorative and meditative practices. We are a passionate, creative and fun loving family, who are committed to giving our guests a deep, friendly, open minded and heart centered experience. After living in New York and traveling the world for over 25 years we decided to set some strong roots together here on the Big Island of Hawai’i where we felt our heavenly oasis close to the ocean as a great place to start! Where enchantment and exploration meet and provide great ‘lookout’ points and beautiful scenic views at the edge of the cliffs of lava. We look forward to sharing the powerful 'mana' (healing life force energy) of this ancient landscape with you soon; on an epic journey to live our lives more abundantly day by day with 'pono' (consciousness) in our hearts! Mahalo Ke Akua (with gratitude to the creator of this life). read less

All bookings are subject to Hawaii Occupancy Tax @ 17.962% (10.25% State Transient Accommodation + 3% County Transient Accommodation + 4.7120% General Excise Tax).

The space

neighborhood_overview:
This is a beautiful and quiet upscale Kona town neighborhood. We are a close-knit community who keep an eye out for each other, and make sure the neighborhood stays safe. Feel secure in knowing that you will be visiting one of the most desirable areas to stay in town.

There are nearby parks with children's play equipment. The immediate neighborhood also has well maintained sidewalks and street lights for taking walks at night and early in the morning, which I recommend to avoid the heat.

Regardless of how safe any neighborhood is, criminals do tend to target rental vehicles. Avoid being a victim of theft; do not leave valuables visible in your vehicle anywhere you park it during your visit.

I like to see live music, watch movies, hike, bike, swim, tour, eat and relax. I spend most of my free time on the Island of Hawai'i, and plan to make it home.

neighborhood_overview: Maui’s unique and varied terrain offers a multitude of activities. From relaxing on some of the world’s most beautiful white sand beaches to the more adventurous undertakings of zip-lining and paragliding. The property's location is such that there are many activities and attractions right at your finger tips. Some of Maui’s top attractions are: Maalaea Harbor - 6 miles - Many boats leave from Maalaea on snorkeling trips, deep sea fishing, scuba diving, whale watching (in season), sunset cruises, and more. It is much faster to leave from Maalaea Harbor than Lahaina Harbor when taking trips to Molokini Crater and Turtle Town. Other attractions include Maui Ocean Center, Haleakala Volcano, Shops at Wailea, Iao Valley, Wailea Golf Club, King Kamehameha Golf Club, Maui Tropical Plantation, and the Whale Sanctuary. The town of Kihei is a quant, laid-back beach town boasting some of Maui’s most pristine stretches of white sand and turquoise waters. South Maui is fun for couples and families

description:
Catch your breath from the hustle and bustle in the serenity of our charming Rollinia Cabin, offering a queen bed, lovely furniture and a bunk bed. Great for families!

The space
KIRPAL MEDITATION AND ECOLOGICAL CENTER (KMEC)

Catch your breath from the hustle and bustle in the serenity of our charming Rollinia Cabin, offering a queen bed, lovely furniture and a bunk bed. It can accommodate up to four people.

The shared kitchen and two fully equipped, clean, and modern bathrooms, also with jungle view, are about 50 feet away.

Our spacious and open 11 acre property is surrounded by a buffer of jungle and features 100 trees with 30 or so kinds of tropical fruit. You're welcome to enjoy the freshest fruit possible whenever they're ripe!

Enjoy a walk half a mile away to the newest formed beach in the world Isaac Kepo'okalani Hale Park. You will walk down Pohoiki road which is full of huge old mango trees that make for a stun
neighborhood_overview: Our location is pristine. Mango Road is a sacred authentic, well preserved landmark to the ancient Hawaiians and so beautiful.
host_about:
Kirpal Meditation and Ecological Center is a half mile from the ocean on the eastern tip of the Big Island of Hawaii, approximately seven miles from the small village of Pahoa. The 10-acre ocean-view property is blessed with average daytime temperatures of 85° F year-round, and 65° F at night, with cool, fragrant trade winds, surrounding tropical flora, including old growth mangoes, nearby swimming, surfing and snorkeling.

This property was once a papaya farm and is now newly planted with bamboo, papaya, palms, banana and many other fruit trees. The octagonal Balinese meditation pavilion is set among shade-trees with an expansive view of the ocean. The island wildlife is all around us – a variety of birds by day and at night there's the pleasant chirping of Coqui frogs – and there are no snakes. Natural wonders include Volcanoes National Park, for lava and crater viewing, volcanically heated warm ponds and steam vents (as outdoor saunas) and other wonders of the lush tropics.

Kmec opened in the summer of 2008 for pre-arranged seasonal meditation retreats and private meditation-vacations on request. Additionally, we would like to extend our welcome to Big Island travelers offering cozy cottages and open air kitchen and bath. We offer daily free meditation instructions and practices at our beautiful Balinese meditation pavillion. Additionally, we offer Yoga and nature tours upon guest's request (donations accepted).

description:

The space

description:

The building has 2 pools, 2 restaurants with bars, convenience store, ice cream shop, and several other stores in the lobby.
Enjoy guava chiffon pancakes with coconut syrup at Cinnamon's on the lobby level while watching the surfers at Ala Moana Bowls.

The space

neighborhood_overview:
Waikoloa Beach is an area located on the South Kohala coast on the island of Hawaii. Approximately 25 minutes north of the Kona International Airport (KOA). The Waikoloa Beach Resort is very family and pedestrian friendly. Most properties are within a 10-15 minute walk (3-5minute drive with ample parking) to ʻAnaehoʻomalu Bay, also known as A-Bay. A-Bay is a shallow water bay located within the resort. ʻAnaehoʻomalu is best known for its sunsets, snorkeling and historic royal fishponds.
The Queens’ MarketPlace and Kings’ Shops provide convenient dining and shopping options.

neighborhood_overview: The ideal location for the "non-tourist" vacation, our location offers a breather form the generic - and often pricey - hustle of the hotel industry.  Live like a local with access to the beach and supermarkets as well as local shopping.  For those looking for tours, there are numerous surf and dive shops within walking distance - and a skate park for all you dry-land board enthusiasts.  Also within walking distance is "The Triangle" - a spectacular collection of local bars, music venues and eateries of all kinds from local Poke and fresh fish to Island BBQ, Mexican food and burgers.
host_about: A recent San Francisco-Bay Area transplant, my love for Maui knows no bounds and am eager to share the enthusiasm I have for my newly adopted home! I'm a screenwriter and an educator when not traveling the world gathering new experiences for my next project.  I never met a two-wheeled vehicle I didn't love, and can be found turtle watching, swimming, snorkeling and sailing when not taking my doggy family for their morning and evening walkies.

neighborhood_overview:
Waikoloa Beach is an area located on the South Kohala coast on the island of Hawaii. Approximately 25 minutes north of the Kona International Airport (KOA). The Waikoloa Beach Resort is very family and pedestrian friendly. Most properties are within a 10-15 minute walk (3-5minute drive with ample parking) to ʻAnaehoʻomalu Bay, also known as A-Bay. A-Bay is a shallow water bay located within the resort. ʻAnaehoʻomalu is best known for its sunsets, snorkeling and historic royal fishponds.
The Queens’ MarketPlace and Kings’ Shops provide convenient dining and shopping options.

host_about: Hello! After many years of vacation club and property ownership, we have had the opportunity to appreciate how extremely convenient and comfortable these style stays can be for all types of travel. As our family has grown, we've found that we have more than we need and are able to utilize every year which lead us to start offering our properties at a great deal to others! With years of experience, our knowledge has allowed us to help others enjoy their vacations and make life long memories. We've been able to grow the services we offer into a business that now also manages multiple different owners with various types of ownerships!  We are happy to be in a place where we can help both owners and vacationers, so don't hesitate to ask for what you need - even if it is not directly listed! We can often book multiple units and/or offer nearby locations. Booking multiple condos at one of our resorts is one of our favorite ways to get family and friends together. Whether you are celebrating or simply spending time together with friends or family, book with us for your next vacation -  Traveling only expands one's horizons!

neighborhood_overview:
The south side of Kihei town is a bustling yet relaxed beach area centered around the famous string of Kamaole Beaches: Kamaole Beach III, Kamaole Beach II, and Kamaole Beach I. Each of these three sections of beach has its own character but they are all scenic and gorgeous. Nightly sunsets are a ritual that many vistors to Maui find are a time to take pause, relax, and breathe in the spirit of Aloha. Sunsets on Kamaole III Beach are no exception!

Nearby to the north you'll find a wide variety of shopping, dining, entertainment, and activities, and a little further to the south is Wailea, another area with shopping and dining and entertainment.

neighborhood_overview: The Royal Coconut Coast is aptly named, not just because of the amazing stands of large coconut trees that cover the landscape, but also because much of the area was originally reserved only for the ali’i or royalty in the Hawaiian kingdom. Today, beautiful white sandy beaches, lush green mountains and valleys, and consistently warm weather all year round attract travelers from all over the world. The Royal Coconut Coast has become a popular tourist destination because of its central location, beauty, rich history and culture, and variety of activities available for the whole family. From Wailua to Kealia, the east side of Kauai offers accommodations for both the budget traveler and those wanting a more full-service resort experience. The whole family can find something to do here, from a leisurely day at the beach or spa, to biking, hiking, kayaking, or golfing, there are many options of how to spend your time on Kauai’s Royal Coconut Coast.

description:
Come enjoy the relaxed tropical setting of this ocean view two-bedroom, two-bath condo. Located in sunny Poipu, you will be minutes away from some of the best beaches Kauai has to offer.

The space
The 1700 square foot condo features a remodeled kitchen that fully equipped with quality cookware, dishes, and utensils, while the spacious living area is tastefully decorated with tropical island-style furnishings. Both master bedroom and guest bedroom offer privacy for families or friends traveling together, and the private lanai can serve as a meeting place where you will share stories of your day’s adventures. book this Poipu Sands vacation rental today!
Please note that this unit has sleeping arrangements for 4 guests. However, a Folding Bed(s) can be arranged to accommodate up to 2 additional guests.

Guest access
Suite Paradise guests have exclusive access to a wide variety of club amenities including tennis, basketball, and pickleball
neighborhood_overview: Poʻipū Beach Park is located in the community of Poʻipū on the southern coast of Kauaʻi island in Hawaii. The beach is a park has lifeguards provided by the county of Kauaʻi.
host_about:
Suite Paradise – The gateway to island living.

Suite Paradise in sunny Poipu Beach on Kauai is home to hundreds of vacation rental properties, amenable to any sized group and any specifications you could think of. With the highest level of service and a wide range of vacation rental options, Suite Paradise can ensure that your stay is as seamless as Kauai’s lifestyle.

Choose from luxurious beach resorts, each with multiple pools and spas within walking distance and top-of-the-line amenities, including, but not limited to, full membership to Poipu Beach Athletic Club for the duration of your stay. Poipu Kai consists of 70 acres of lush tropical foliage and some of Kauai’s most sought-after vacation rentals. One complex is literally located nestled in a verdant and extinct volcano crater – you can’t get more immersed in the island lifestyle than that! From mauka (mountain) to makai (sea), Suite Paradise has something for you!

Kahala – A popular complex that is home to mostly one- and two-bedroom units. Kahala is only a short walk from the beach, and closest to Poipu Kai’s tennis courts and Kalapaki Joe’s sports bar. With the option of both mountain and ocean views available dependent on the unit, Kahala’s location is perfectly situated with proximity to Poipu Road as well as the Poipu Kai greenbelt.

Makanui – Two- and three-bedroom units perched across from Poipu Crater, with stunning mountain views, distant ocean views, and a short walk to the greenbelt path.

Manualoha –Less than a mile from the beach, although the complex pool is practically attached to the Pacific Ocean! With units sleeping four to six, easy access to the greenbelt pathway, and hues of purple bougainvillea draped throughout the complex.

Poipu Sands – One- and two-bedroom units with incredible ocean views, spacious lanais, and a short walk to Shipwreck’s Beach.

Regency – Larger units, spacious enough to accommodate up to 10 guests. Many of these units are newly remodeled and offer AC. Regency and Kahala sit right next to each other.

Regency Villas – Luxury units with central AC. Regency Villas often feature a loft and sleep up to five guests. Situated near the greenbelt for easy access to many resort amenities, and centrally located for a short walk to Brennecke's Beach, or access to the Grand Hyatt Kauai Resort.

Nihi Kai Villas - A comfortable and quiet beach resort with 70 condos to choose from. Located right across from the ocean.

Poipu Crater – Just as the name says, Poipu Crater is nestled in a verdant an extinct volcano crater, which makes the foliage truly breathtaking. With 30 condos to choose from, sleeping four to six guests, the choice is yours! Enjoy the tropical gardens and central location to all that Poipu has to offer.

Lawai Beach Resort - Luxurious oceanfront condos located directly across from arguably the best snorkeling spot on the island. Enjoy a short stroll to five-star dining at The Beach House or enjoy the view from Lawai Beach, as the surfers paddle out for a sunset session. With room to sleep up to six, Lawai Beach Resort has it all!

Poipu Kapili - A beautiful and peaceful resort located on five acres of meticulously landscaped oceanfront property.

Pili Mai - This is Kauai’s newest resort development of luxury condominiums, nestled among a championship golf course.

description:
Welcome to Mollie's Paradise! This gated resort vacation home features a beautifully crafted outdoor paradise with a private pool and spa.

But what sets this resort home apart is the details -- your host has curated a vacation home experience that will bring you back again and again because of the quality and ability to customize prior to your arrival.

The space
Be the first to stay at this brand new luxury resort home!

Tucked away in the gated resort community of Holuakai at Keauhou, this resort home is a destination on its own! It features 3 bedrooms and 2.5 bathrooms, fully stocked kitchen, living room and dining room with a private outdoor paradise.

Your host took exactly what she looks for in a vacation home and incorporated those elements. What does this mean? EVERYTHING is washed and sanitized every single stay (i.e. there are no throw pillows on beds!), organic and natural skin and hair care products are provided,

And to island hop with my family to harder to reach places like Molokai and Lanai.

description:

All within walking distance...

The kitchen is open for entertaining...The solid Brazilian granite counter
neighborhood_overview: Kihei is safe...You can stroll the beach on a beautiful moonlit evening with no worries...Our side of the island (South) is considered the sunny side...We have the best beaches on the island!
host_about: Retired family man... Maureen and I returned to Maui full time in 2007 after living in Santa Fe, New Mexico for 14 Years.  Maui has always held a special place in our hearts so after selling our business and home in Santa Fe we retired and moved home to Maui..  We now have our children and grand children living on Maui and will be here for the rest of our lives..

description:
Luana Moana's Lanai is 50 ft from Maalaea Bay. Get mesmerized by the unobstructed Panoramic Views! Feel Trade Winds blowing your Hair and the Sun warming your skin. Vitality is Everywhere!
When You have entered Luana Moana:
You have No Past,
You are Not Planning Your Future,
You are Present in The Moment,
Your Soul seeks Harmony with the Ocean,
Your Spirit is being Renewed with every crash of the waves against the seawall, with every Sunrise Meditation or Sunset Reflection...
You are Alive!

The space
Spacious Oceanfront 950 sq ft condo, 2 BR(Kings), 2BA. 50 feet from the Ocean. Unobstructed Panoramic View of Ma'alaea Bay on the South Side of Maui Island. In the saddle of the island with the Trade Winds lifting your spirit. Luana Moana has Been UPDATED to Feature: a Virtual Assistant, Wireless Chargers, installed USB port throughout, streaming Spectrum, bidets and bluetooth speakers, backlit dimmable mirrors with de-steam butto
neighborhood_overview: Luana Moana lives in Lauloa Complex of the enclave in Ma'alaea Bay. The street name is Hau'oli Street, which means Happy in Hawaiian. This street is a dead-end road, which means no thru traffic. Quiet and Calming are 2 words to describe this location. In walking distance(on one side) is Ma'alaea Beach, which the locals call it Haycraft Beach. Walking in the opposite direction will be the Ma'alaea Harbor, which has the Maui Ocean Center and Maui Harbor Shops. Great location for any dinner, snorkeling cruises, Genral Store, Reek Cafe, Taute's Fish Restaurant, Seascapes restaurant, Beach Bums, Playground (Live Music Bar), and the Aquarium.
host_about:
I created Luana Moana Signature Oceanfront Maui. Luana Moana became a vision I had after my first experience opening the front door and hearing and seeing the ocean. The connection was Powerful that I wanted to incorporate it into the surroundings of Luana Moana. Letting the life force of the ocean and all the glory of sunrise and sunsets fill Luana Moana with vitality. My Vision allows Guests to Be in The Present Moment. Surround themselves in Classy. Luxury! Updated Technology. GREEN. Natural elements Decor.  Easy Comfort...all while Focusing on Connection with the Ocean. 
I have an extensive global travel industry experience and know what I have appreciated during my travels. These elements I have incorporated into Luana Moana, which I hope you appreciate as well. 
I'm excited to share with you the Spirit and Harmony Luana Moana has given to me…Life is Really about Sharing These Moments. 
The Life Energy is All around you the moment You step on Luana Moana's Lanai. I Hope You Feel It Too... Nourishing Your Soul.

The breezy beach house theme continues indoor outdoor with large windows and neutral hues. The house is tucked away in a safe peaceful cul-de-sac in the residential Hanalei Palms neighborhood. Take a stroll to the beach, ride a cruiser bike, paddle out and catch some waves on a surfboard, boogie board or SUP up the Hanalei River or around the Bay. All provided for you!

Other things to note

neighborhood_overview:
The beautiful town of Hanalei was designed as a holiday island paradise. Its stunning beach, mountain scenery, and fabulous weather conditions will make you want to spend most of your holiday outdoors. Hanalei beach is perfect for surfing, body boarding, SUP, swimming, lazing around or taking part in traditional beach games, as well as enjoying a dip in the clean warm waters.

The pier at Hanalei was featured in the South Pacific musical and is an important part of the towns culture. It’s also used for fishing, social, and musical gatherings.

Hanalei Town is famed for its dedication to Kauai’s island history. Its art galleries contain carvings produced by indigent tribes from local wood. Here, you will get to dine at the best in Kauai cuisine’s and traditional restaurants.

Experience all the life & Aloha the island of Maui has to offer in your private detached bungalow located on an old 8 acre fruit plantation, just steps from the ocean. This is a unique experience...there’s nothing quite like "Ka Hale Aloha" on island.

* Check us out on IG at @kahalealoha *

The space

Enjoy your complimentary morning coffee or tea with the ocean breeze, monarch butterflies and sea turtles. All with stunning views of neighboring islands Moloka‘i and Lanai just steps from your front door.

During fruit season, pick your own breakfast from the mango tree right off of your private lanai, or enjoy many of the other tropical fruits the

Practice yoga in the grass with views of the ocean. Bask in the sun from the lounge chairs of our community's private oceanfront. Enjoy incredible sunsets with your evening drink of choice or dinner on the waterfront picnic tables.

- 2 pools
- tennis court
- basketball hoop
- local fruit
- free parking

- oceanfront and garden bbq's, picnic tables & lounge chairs

host_about:
Carter and Shelby are soulmates and realtors in Hawaii and the Bay Area.
Our passion for real estate and travel is combined with "Ka Hale Aloha-The Love Shack." We take so much pride in our work and are here to give you the most memorable experience possible. 

With roots in Maui Hawaii and the west coast we have a community on island and the mainland and a life full of gratitude. We love water sports, hiking, nature, exploring, live music and dining out! You can always find us together with our pup Shiloh chasing our dreams and enjoying every moment in life.

description:
Open windows to let mountain breezes flow through a little house that's big on character. At 4000 ft elevation, experience a unique upland rain forest climate where it's cool enough to relax by the fireplace or enjoy a soak out in the hot tub. Located on the grounds of our 1930s plantation house, in the heart of historic Volcano Village, The Maid's Quarters cottage is within walking distance of all village shops and restaurants, and just a few minutes drive from Hawaii Volcanoes National Park.

The space
The cottage is in the Hale Ohia Tract, a residential historic district of Volcano Village on a one lane road with no thru-traffic. This high elevation area, with a cool mountain climate, was historically a vacation retreat for the well-to-do of the Big Island of Hawaii, where they escaped the heat of the lowlands. In the 1930's our house was the Hutchinson Sugar Mill plantation manager's retreat, and The Maid's Quarters cottage was indeed where the servants stayed
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is in the Hale Ohia Tract, a residential historic district of Volcano Village on a one lane road with no thru-traffic. This high elevation area, with a cool mountain climate, was historically a vacation retreat for the well-to-do of the Big Island of Hawaii, where they escaped the heat of the lowlands. Our house belonged to the Hutchinson Sugar Company, and The Maid's Quarters cottage was indeed where the servants stayed when the plantation managers vacationed in Volcano.
host_about: An outdoorsman with an extreme sense of adventure, Todd can direct you to the popular as well as the lesser-known places of interest around Volcano and the Big Island of Hawaii for cycling, trail running, hiking or beach going -- or simply going for a scenic drive and a great place to eat!

description:
Cute one bedroom cabin on Pupukea property. Private driveway. Other dwellings on property. Large private deck to enjoy reading or watching movies, daytime naps after surfing or beach going. Minutes from famous North Shore beaches, Haleiwa Town with restaurants and shopping.

The space
The cabin sits on an acre with fruit trees. Owners live on property next to cabin. There are pets on property. There is Wi-Fi. The home is older but very comfortable and nice, uncluttered. There is a sliding glass door in the bedroom for easy access to the covered deck with a roku tv to eat, read or watch movies. The kitchen has everything needed to cook meals. The kitchen has a table with chairs. The living room area has a couch and coffee table.

Guest access
Guests are more than welcome to enjoy the yard and say hello to the tortoise in the back. We have a stone outdoor shower you are welcome to use. The outdoor shower has hot and cold water. Peo
neighborhood_overview: Pupukea has some lovely hiking  and biking trails that go off into the forest.  The views are incredible with sweeping ocean views from some of the roads.  The neighborhood consists of acre parcels and a few farms.  All of the houses are different.  Very unique. Quiet most of the time.  There are chickens, lizards and dogs.  There are flocks of wild parrots and beautiful plants and flowers everywhere thanks to the neighbors.
host_about:
We are a hard working family living on Oahu.  We moved to Hawaii from the East Coast over 20 years ago.  

We love the ocean (surfing, swimming, snorkeling).  We also love hiking.  Our children are going to college, high school and working here and on the mainland.   

I have 1 horse and love being outdoors and with family and friends.

Our home is also within 1 mile of a great local grocery store, pharmacy, bank, doctors , dentist, gas station , restaurants, & food court. Unit is located on the ground floor.

The space
Slide into island mode in this spacious 1,183 sq. ft. home at the edge of the ocean. Sip coffee at sunrise on the lanai spanning the living area and master bedroom. Then enjoy breakfast prepped in the full kitchen. Touches include ceiling fans, flat screen, and WiFi. Sleeps 6 in 1 King and 2 Twins.

Slip into an easy-going Kauai lifestyle at this east Kauai oceanfront condo fringing snorkeling favorite Lydgate Beach Park. With a full kitchen and private lanai, each Kaha Lani vacation suite features access to the resort’s heated swimming pool, tennis court, and barbecue area.

host_about:
Kaha Lani Resort vacation rentals in Lihue are one of Kauai’s best-kept secrets!

Our condominiums bring you prime views of Kauai’s oceanfront. Think swaying palm trees, fine white sand, and dreamy ocean blues. Spend your days sun-kissed at our heated swimming pool and sundeck or snorkel at Lydgate Beach Park. At Kaha Lani Resort you can sunbathe at the sandy beach, challenge a friend to a tennis match, and then summon your family for a barbeque as the sun goes down.

With these Lihue condo rentals, you get all the benefits of resort-style Kauai accommodations in a place as comfortable as home. We have laundry facilities, DVD rentals in the lobby, and free parking, making it easy to come and go as you please for as long as you like.

Since 1993, Castle Resorts & Hotels has specialized in innovative hotel and resort management. We manage properties throughout the Hawaiian Islands, including Kauai, Oahu, Maui, Molokai, and Hawaii Island, as well as Auckland, New Zealand. Accommodations range from full-service hotels to resort condominiums and combines value, convenience, and authentic experiences.

description:
Hale Momo is a beautiful 4 bedroom, 3 bathrooms, air-conditioned private home located just one block away from world-famous Poipu and Brennecke's beaches.

The space
Situated at the end of a cul-de-sac on a quiet street in sunny Poipu, you can walk to the beach in 2 minutes. You can enjoy a peaceful and relaxing environment while being just steps from surfing, body boarding, snorkeling, sunbathing, picnic areas, restaurants, and shopping.
Hale Momo was featured on the popular TV show "House Hunters" on HGTV in September 2013!
The home features a spacious living room, 3 wraparound lanais, a fully-equipped kitchen, and a games room (including foosball and ping pong). There are two TVs and free internet WiFi. One of the 4 bedrooms functions as a second master suite and can be locked off as a private studio if desired and has its own private entrance that also connects internally to the rest of the house.
Outside you will enjoy the large lovely, privat
neighborhood_overview: Poʻipū Beach Park is located in the community of Poʻipū on the southern coast of Kauaʻi island in Hawaii. The beach is a park has lifeguards provided by the county of Kauaʻi.
host_about:
Suite Paradise – The gateway to island living.

Suite Paradise in sunny Poipu Beach on Kauai is home to hundreds of vacation rental properties, amenable to any sized group and any specifications you could think of. With the highest level of service and a wide range of vacation rental options, Suite Paradise can ensure that your stay is as seamless as Kauai’s lifestyle.

Choose from luxurious beach resorts, each with multiple pools and spas within walking distance and top-of-the-line amenities, including, but not limited to, full membership to Poipu Beach Athletic Club for the duration of your stay. Poipu Kai consists of 70 acres of lush tropical foliage and some of Kauai’s most sought-after vacation rentals. One complex is literally located nestled in a verdant and extinct volcano crater – you can’t get more immersed in the island lifestyle than that! From mauka (mountain) to makai (sea), Suite Paradise has something for you!

Kahala – A popular complex that is home to mostly one- and two-bedroom units. Kahala is only a short walk from the beach, and closest to Poipu Kai’s tennis courts and Kalapaki Joe’s sports bar. With the option of both mountain and ocean views available dependent on the unit, Kahala’s location is perfectly situated with proximity to Poipu Road as well as the Poipu Kai greenbelt.

Makanui – Two- and three-bedroom units perched across from Poipu Crater, with stunning mountain views, distant ocean views, and a short walk to the greenbelt path.

Manualoha –Less than a mile from the beach, although the complex pool is practically attached to the Pacific Ocean! With units sleeping four to six, easy access to the greenbelt pathway, and hues of purple bougainvillea draped throughout the complex.

Poipu Sands – One- and two-bedroom units with incredible ocean views, spacious lanais, and a short walk to Shipwreck’s Beach.

Regency – Larger units, spacious enough to accommodate up to 10 guests. Many of these units are newly remodeled and offer AC. Regency and Kahala sit right next to each other.

Regency Villas – Luxury units with central AC. Regency Villas often feature a loft and sleep up to five guests. Situated near the greenbelt for easy access to many resort amenities, and centrally located for a short walk to Brennecke's Beach, or access to the Grand Hyatt Kauai Resort.

Nihi Kai Villas - A comfortable and quiet beach resort with 70 condos to choose from. Located right across from the ocean.

Poipu Crater – Just as the name says, Poipu Crater is nestled in a verdant an extinct volcano crater, which makes the foliage truly breathtaking. With 30 condos to choose from, sleeping four to six guests, the choice is yours! Enjoy the tropical gardens and central location to all that Poipu has to offer.

Lawai Beach Resort - Luxurious oceanfront condos located directly across from arguably the best snorkeling spot on the island. Enjoy a short stroll to five-star dining at The Beach House or enjoy the view from Lawai Beach, as the surfers paddle out for a sunset session. With room to sleep up to six, Lawai Beach Resort has it all!

Poipu Kapili - A beautiful and peaceful resort located on five acres of meticulously landscaped oceanfront property.

Pili Mai - This is Kauai’s newest resort development of luxury condominiums, nestled among a championship golf course.

host_about: I am originally from San Diego and moved to NYC 18 years ago and as much as I love NYC I need a getaway and Maui for me is pure paradise. I rented at the Palms several times and fell in love with the property but was never that happy with the units I rented I think because I usually got carpeted units which I dislike and the entertainment features were old fashioned and I love to spend my evenings at home cooking and enjoying good movie. I am a Hairstylist and photographer in NYC and have a love for the right lighting so you allways look your best. Peter Lik is a photgrapher that has inspired me to capture beautiful landscapes and I print the on fujiflexchrome crystal archive paper which is light sensitive which is why I have everyting on dimmers. I also want to say that living in NYC I am exposed to the latest trends and styles. I love hotels like the W because they have a modern but simple way of making life feel new and refreshing and the old hawaiian style with wicker, floral prints and old hawaiian art is just so last decade I needed to go contemporary. With 2 nonstop flights to Honolulu from NYC I can ony hope that my style will enspire you to stay with me.

description:

We are located on the North Shore of Oahu just to the right of famous Sunset Beach on Sunset Point. A unique property that allows you to view the beautiful Hawaiian sunsets 365 days a year. Summer time is amazing snorkeling with calm crystal clear water in front of home and Winter time some of the best waves in the world are just out the door at backyards surf break .

This is a two bedroom direct oceanfront home with a king size bed in the master, queen/full size in second bedroom and two full pull out sleeper's in living area. Air conditioning & cable TV in both bedrooms as well as living room. We have a twin floor mattress and baby pack & play if needed.
A private roof top deck, gas grill, private outdoor shower, beach chairs, snorkel gear, washer/dryer, fully equipped kitchen, beach t

neighborhood_overview:
The BEACH, Tamura's Market, Longs/CVS, Papa Ole's, North Shore Tacos, US Post Office, Medical Clinic, Prime Rib Truck, Korean BBQ and the Polynesian Convenience Store are ALL within walking distance.
Laie, Polynesian Cultural Center, Kahuku, Malaekahana and Turtle Bay are minutes away and the Sunset Beach on the North Shore around 20-25 minutes from the Hale.
Drive further to the Banzai Pipeline, Waimea Bay and then into historic Haleiwa Town. Visit Mokuleia Beach and hike around Kaena Point. The possibilities are endless. Drive around the island and visit Ko'Olina, the West side, the outlets in Waikele, Ka Makana Alii Shopping Center and venture into town for Ala Moana Center, Waikiki, Kakaako & the hikes in Diamond Head and Koko Head. Memorable place such as Punchbowl Cemetary and Pearl Harbor are not far off the beaten path.
host_about:
My husband I have worked tirelessly to  achieve and never forget where we have come from. I was once a homeless couch surfer and he came from a privileged family, yet humble and kind as can be. We met in the most unlikely place in the middle of Hawaii and have been with each other ever since. We own the real estate, however, I am the management team of the properties. This has become my full-time career along with the crazy restaurant in Hawaii. I put in 120% energy when embarking on a purchase of real property and converting into the ultimate vacation or long term rental experience. Yes, I do both. I grew up in the world of hospitality on the Islands of Maui and Oahu. I have eaten, resided and worked with all demographics. I love to travel and have stayed in my fair share of short term rentals that were never meant to be advertised as such. I used this as education and the inspiration to start one of my most successful ventures in my life. I know what I am truly passionate about. The pandemic was a two fold lesson and I am learning to embrace the change everyday. I hope you enjoy the mountain house or the hale in Hawaii as much as we do. It is the fruit of my hard work to read the honest review of another human who, recognizes how much effort was put forth.
I would love to invite anyone, who reads to the end of this story, a complimentary item or discount to their Experience Activity in Hawaii, a new form of business we decided to partner with Airbnb with.  The Surf and Bento package Experience is live. Please stay tuned on canoe rides, VIP tours and lei creation classes. We are bringing back the vintage world. 
Kim

Enjoy a slice of paradise at our well appointed contemporary Hawaiian Hale - Kailani Studio Condo. Tropical greenery and plumeria add a sense of tranquility to the interior decor. Newly renovated with a draping canopy bed, brand new kitchen appliances and spotless bathroom.

The space

It includes a romantic canopy bed with chiffon draping, plumeria and Hawaiian turtle (honu) wall decors. host_about:
Aloha,
I’m Linda. Hilo is my beloved hometown. I live here with my husband, raising our 8 year old son on the old-fashioned, yet beautiful Big Island of Hawaii. I love working as a tour guide since 2014, showing our wonderful island to visitors from all over the world. From my experience interacting with the visitors, I realized lots of them desired lodging with modern decorations yet maintaining an old Hawaiian feel. That’s exact what I aim to do when I was lucky enough to be able to open and host my first Airbnb. Kailani studio is my attempt to accommodate guests with a mix of modern and old Hawaiian flare. I hope to provide all my guests an old yet modern Hawaiian retreat after they tour our “time-forgotten”’east Hawaii, and provide the best customer services to make your day full of Aloha! 
Mahalo!
Linda

The space

We provide simple breakfast items to get you started including banana bread made from our own banana and coconut trees and eggs from our chicks, and local coffee.
It features a large fully equipped kitchen and triple sliders opening up into your own private lanai with outdoor dining and lounge area. There is a large
neighborhood_overview:
Closest B&B to the Airport- We are very centrally located with easy access to all parts of the island, and within minutes of all major amenities- Airport, Hospital, shopping, restaurants, theater, beaches, and area attractions.
We are within walking distance to Maui Arts and Cultural Center, Keopuolani Regional Park and Dog Park, YMCA, Baseball and Football Stadiums, Botanical Gardens, Saturday Farmer's Market and Flea Market, and public transportation.
It's just a short drive to Iao Valley State Park, Waihee Coastal Dunes, Iao Theater, Wailuku Town and many other spots to explore.
This is a quiet local neighborhood so we have strict quiet hours between 8pm and 8am. For the party scene head to Paia, Kihei, or Lahaina, then return for some tranquility and relaxation.
host_about: We’ve been traveling to Hawaii for many years to visit family here, and have now retired to Maui to be near our Daughter and grandchildren, after long and fulfilling careers in Health Care and Education on the East Coast.

description:
On the Big Island’s west coast, you’ll find this delightful retreat built to capture the natural wonder of Kailua-Kona. Beautifully designed to capture the charm of the 1930s, you’ll want for no modern amenity. Outdoor pools and the nearby beach are just the beginning of what’s within reach.

The space
"Location,location, only 1 mile to Kona town & just a 5 minute walk to the nearest beach! We really have it all: restaurants, shopping, snorkeling, surfing , golf, great swimming & more truly within 5 miles of this upscale condo . Great resort amenities also with : pool, jacuzzi, fitness enter, & business center. Beautiful, spacious interior & oversized balcony. We have a full on site staff for Check in & concierge
host_about: I have access to 200+ resorts throughout the country that offer a much better vacation experience when compared to a hotel room. These are primarily Club Wyndham. Our resorts allow our renters access to amenities and privileges that are normally reserved for owners. Enjoy full kitchens that come with all the basic supplies you need to cook for yourself or friends and family, in-suite washer and dryer, 24-hour security, maintenance staff and front desk personnel and a concierge to help you make the most of your stay

description:
Kaiolu Sunrise is the perfect Waikiki vacation. This is the kind of place that I always wanted to stay in when traveling to Honolulu. This is a large 1 bedroom, 1 bath unit that comfortably sleeps 4 people and includes a full kitchen with utensils, cookware and dishes, TV / internet, ceiling fans / air conditioning (in bedroom), a big walk in closet and a designated parking space.

The space
Our favorite thing to do is to greet the rising sun early in the morning on the large lanai (105 sq. feet) while having breakfast above the quiet street below.

Guest access
Heated pool with large patio area and a large gas BBQ grill.
Washer/dryer ( $1.5 per load) and trash chute located on every floor.
There is a surfboard rack (the key is prepared by yourself). Emergency stairs on each floor

Other things to note
A small building – only 11 floors high, very clean and ideally

neighborhood_overview: A bus stop that connects you to 9 different lines that bring you throughout Honolulu is a block away.
host_about: Aloha! We both fell in love with Hawaii on our own over 25 years ago. As a couple we love to travel and kept finding ourselves returning to the islands for vacation. Over the years we've been blessed to have many friends who have introduced us to the spirit of Aloha.  It was only last year that we decided to make Hawaii an integral part of our future. We embrace having one foot in California and one foot in Hawaii - Where else is it commonplace to see three rainbows at a time !!!
